attributes.comment:
Dear Sir,
I am writing in opposition to the USCIS's notice of proposed rulemaking USCIS-
2006-0044 to increase the fees specifically for I-600 applications and the
fingerprinting applications. My husband and I have completed this paperwork now
TWICE for the adopton of a child in Russia. Beyond our control, the Russian
Government has held up the paperwork on reaccrediting foreign adoption agencies
operating in Russia, thereby impacting the timeline of our adoption. Because the
adoption timeline from referral to final court date has taken over a year to
complete, we have had to re-do all of our paperwork, including the I-600
application AND getting re-fingerprinted (I am not sure how fingerprints "expire"
especially when they are recorded in digital format). We have now paid the fee
twice for the updating of both the I-600 and the fingerprints. The costs for adoption
are quite prohibitive already. I am respectfully asking that the fees associated
with the forms required for adoption not be increased as proposed in USCIS-2006-
0044. Thank you for your consideration in this important matter.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Lynn Platter
